purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of resources required to achieve a specified objective.
purpose.note: A resource requirement that is identifiable is represented as .
A resource requirement that is specified is represented as .
purpose.example: A spare part with part number "KSB 1234" is a identifiable resource - .
The replaceble unit with part number "F1234-123456" and serial number "123-456" is a identifiable resource - .
A person with social sequrity number "501022-2345" is a identifiable resource - .
The need for 240 V power supply is a requirement specification - .
purpose.p: Resource requirements may have the following characteristics:

ul.li: A resource requirement can be specified or identified;
A resource requirement can be quantified;
A resource requirement or resource requirement grouping can be classified.

purpose.p: The following are not enabled by this module alone but are enabled by modules that use this module:

ul.li: Property, date and descriptive representation assignment;
Recording of the organizations or people in organizations who identify an item as satisfying a resource requirement;

purpose.note:
A required resource can be given an identifier using the required_resource_identification_item in the
Required resource characterized module.

A required resource and/or a required resource relationship can be given a dated effectivity using the required_resource_effectivity_item in the
Required resource characterized module.

inscope.li: Resource requirements that refer to both actual and types of items;

outscope.li: Identification and detailed descriptions of required resources;
Recording of used or consumed resources.

uof.name: Required_resource
uof.description: The Required_resource UoF lists the resources required to achieve a specified objectice. The UoF provides both resource specification and resource identification capabilities.
